intro: Phaeopappus scleroblepharus, commonly known as the dark-eyed pappus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant is distinguished by its dark purple to blackish flower heads, which contrast with its gray-green foliage. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
